content: The following steps might be helpful: (On the message pane) tap the three vertical dots on the right hand side of the sender > "Forward".
creator: Yu5tiqX9og

content: Okay. So in case this happens to anyone else: To fix this, I took the easy and obvious path. I removed the account and then added it back in. All it good again.
creator: rick163

content: I had the same issue on Thunderbird Android with one email account not syncing. While troubleshooting, I came across truesides.com where they reminded me technology isn’t just about gadgets, algorithms, or innovations. It’s about how it shapes our world. In an era overflowing with information, clarity is key—and Truesides really helped me focus on fixing what truly matters instead of getting lost in random fixes.
creator: alipoint974

content:
I faced the same issue once on my Android phone. One of my accounts just stopped syncing while others worked fine. What helped me was going into Account Settings → Server Settings and checking the IMAP details. After that, I cleared the app cache and re-added the account — it started working again.

Maybe try that once. Thunderbird Android sometimes just loses connection with one account randomly.
creator: lw_909
